The real issues du jour:
Do you wash your new underwear before wearing?

@WexfordSinfonia And weâ€™ve gone very minimalist... havenâ€™t done up a room, donâ€™t plan to (will paint and decorate a room when theyâ€™re old enough to pick their own colours.) Have somewhere for him/her to sleep, and some clothes. Plan to breastfeed... thatâ€™s it!
@chunky66 I buy my knickers in packets. â€˜Nuff said ðŸ˜‚ #cheap

@chunky66 Tumble dryer, all the way ðŸ˜‚ (bed sheets and towels for the clothes line, but Iâ€™m not fussing with undies and socks when I can lash them into the dryer, no matter how hot it is outside!)
@laniamh I mean, they werenâ€™t on someoneâ€™s crotch ðŸ¤·ðŸ½â€â™€ï¸ (unless you got an open pack = no).

@CrossyTweets So, itâ€™s not just me? I just never even considered it. New clothes = wear straight away. I might not even wash the babyâ€™s new vests and babygros, tbh. Theyâ€™re in a packet!

I did a quick poll in work and turns out, lots of people wash their smalls before wearing.
I am so conflicted. I canâ€™t stop thinking about it.

It all began with an innocent remark about washing all the babyâ€™s clothes before using them. (I wouldnâ€™t have thought I needed to)
NOW, Iâ€™m told grown-up humans wash their undies straight out of the packet before wearing. I love the joy of crispy new knickers out of the pack ðŸ˜•
